comment: Hes chill. Hes not very accessible as he never responded to emails. It made things stressful, but it ended up being an easy A, so I cant complain.

The grading criteria is 4 tests, recitation ws, and hw. There is hw almost every week, the recitation ws were completed in class. The lecture before the test was a review of the material and was VERY similar to the test. If you go to the review days the tests are not bad. The class was not too bad.

Really good prof. class is super easy. homework every week but it was never an issue. recitation sets are done in class so its easy as long as you go to class. Easy credit. Also really likes it if you participate in lecture. very willing to help students out.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Have to purchase a lab manual. Show up to lab, and Professor Alomari will show you how to do most everything. If he leaves the class on its own, he will make rounds and make sure you're alright. Super chill in general and very lenient on grading. No need for lab reports, only scan work from the lab manual. Very easy!

Had WebAssign hw, an online quiz, and a worksheet for recitation due every week. Lots of work, but easy. 3 tests and a final on LockDown. Didn't find that going to his lectures were helpful, randomly gave bonus points though. Learned the material through Organic Chemistry Tutor on YT. Tests and final exactly like the review, allows a cheat sheet.

(Prefer 3.5) My main negatives are Lockdown exams, WebAssign, rarely responds to emails, and downloading lectures. However, Dr. Alomari held live + recorded recitation sessions on solving recitations and encouraged participation, and exams would be a variant of them + reviews. Great grading policy, but self-studying is necessary for success.

Class is overall easy. Quizzes and homework allowed 2 attempts. Exams are very similar or sometimes are the exact questions from the review. Made us participate because no one would answer his questions but gave out extra credit point for it. You will have to teach yourself sometimes.

This was a synchronous online class where we met once a week. He wasn't the best at explaining things verbally, but his lecture notes were amazing. Just study those, and your golden. I didn't bother with the PowerPoints. His exams are pretty much like his reviews. If you already have a Physics background, TAKE HIM. Easy! HW is not too much either.

So far, this is not a good online professor. Better in person, so you can interact. Provides so many examples and problems to where he will overwhelm you. If you do not interact with him, he will speed through recitations or lectures (has done it on numerous occasions). Does not provide an incentive to communicate and there is no extra credit.

Currently, for lectures, has been putting up multiple videos. So I am constantly downloading multiple videos. I just don't get why he doesn't make one whole video for a chapter. Two, expects you to understand multiple concepts within a short period of time. Lastly, gives you rope to hand yourself, so that if you mess up, you might as well drop.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--So many papers

comment: Professor Alomari just isn't qualified to teach online. you have to sign up for webassign which costs over a hundred for the semester just to do the homework. his assignments are scattered and don't make sense, you can't understand his speech during online lectures ( he's using apple earbuds as a microphone ) and he says uhhh for 1/3 of lecture.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: Stay away from this class! very disorganized. It was online due to COVID. His teaching method is awful, Nobody could understand what he taught. I did not learn anything from him . Tests were easy but you have to study on your own and ask help from google and other online resources. I am so disappointed! Does not respond to emails as well!
Easy choice for Phys 1111. Straightforward homework and tests. 3 chances to take the quizzes and exams. Great guy.
